data.description: Provides an overview of the variety of political actors (bureaucrats, elected politicians, courts, interest groups, media outlets, the public) involved in the policy process, and what's distinct about policymaking today; a focus on policy implementation, drawing on concepts, tools and theory from public administration, public management, and organizational behavior. Learn concepts and skills through hands-on activities such as case studies, simulations, policy writing, and debates.
data.title: POLICY ACTORS, INSTITUTIONS, AND THE POLICY PROCESS

data.description: Basic institutions and processes of American government. The role of constitutional structures, parties, interest groups and elections in the system; policy formation and policy content.
data.title: INTRODUCTION TO AMERICAN POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT
